Some sources and control devices can have periods of high opacity followed by periods of low or zero opacity. These sources are considered to have intermittent emissions.

If a source has intermittent emissions or a continuous emission period of less than 6 minutes, an alternative test method may be needed. Alternative test methods (described later in the course), allow for lower averaging times and decreased time intervals between observations. The sourceâ€™s permit will usually state if an alternative test method should be used.
